subject: Cybersecurity
title: The Right to Be Forgotten: Erasing Your Past Online
description: A quick win: understand The Right to Be Forgotten: Erasing Your Past Online.

hook.text: A man asked Google to remove a 16-year-old auction notice. He won the case and created a new right for all Europeans.

buildup.text: In 2014, the EU Court ruled people can ask search engines to remove outdated or irrelevant personal information.

discovery.text: Google received over 1.5 million removal requests. It removes about 48% â€” balancing privacy with public interest.

twist.text: The right clashes with press freedom. Should a politician erase articles about past corruption because.

climax.text: The internet's perfect memory challenges human nature. People grow and change, but search results don't.

punchline.text: The internet never forgets. The law says it must.
